result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Berkhahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J. Berkhahn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J. Berkhahn was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime work or fulltime school and when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
No controlled substances unless has a valid prescription.
No contact with victim L.C. unless authorized by PO.

Enroll in and complete SAFE program.
Submit to random UA checks.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
45 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges to be granted for work, school, treatment, NA and AA meetings and Smart Recovery if appropriate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called: 2:47pm
INCLUDES 14CF392 & 14CF640
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Joshua Berkhahn. 

Parties make argument on sentencing recommendation.
Defendant reads statement to Court. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF392 Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony: Serve 1 year MCJ. 175 days jail credit granted. Jail may be with huber release for work, work search, or treatment if meets jail criteria. Any outstanding costs to be converted into civil judgment.
COURT ORDERS: 14CF640 Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony: Serve 90 days MCJ, concurrent to Ct. 3 & Consecutive to 14CF392 Ct. 1. Ct. 3 Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse repeater- domestic abuse repeater- domestic abuse: Serve 90 days MCJ, concurrent to Ct. 1 & Consecutive to 14CF392 Ct. 1. Jail may be with Huber release or on EMP if meets jail criteria. Zero days credit granted on consecutive sentences. Any outstanding costs to be converted into civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS: with hold sentencing in 14CF640 Ct. 1 & Ct. 3 and 14CF392 Ct. 1. Probabtion of 3 years concurrent. Enroll and complete SAFE program as recommended. AODA and any follow up. Provide DNA sample and surcharge. 45 days credit in 14CF392 & 42 days credit in 14CF640. No contact with victim L.C. unless by probabtion agent.
